abstract: The government may seek to ease General Motors into what it calls a “controlled” bankruptcy, somewhere between a prepackaged bankruptcy and court chaos, by persuading at least some creditors to agree to a plan that would cleave the company into two pieces, Michael J. de la Merced and Jonathan D. Glater of The New York Times reported, citing people briefed on the matter.
lead_paragraph: The government may seek to ease General Motors into what it calls a “controlled” bankruptcy, somewhere between a prepackaged bankruptcy and court chaos, by persuading at least some creditors to agree to a plan that would cleave the company into two pieces, Michael J. de la Merced and Jonathan D. Glater of The New York Times reported, citing people briefed on the matter.

headline.main: U.S. Plan Sees Easing of G.M. to Bankruptcy
